body_html:
I came to open an issue and found this =)
Even without modifying the API to add dims=() as in the request of the Op, maybe it's possible to monkey patch torch in runtime so that torch.Size().__repr__() prints torch.Size([batch=B, seq=S, dim=D]) if there's an attribute say _dim_names in the Tensor?
body_text:
I came to open an issue and found this =)
Even without modifying the API to add dims=() as in the request of the Op, maybe it's possible to monkey patch torch in runtime so that  torch.Size().__repr__() prints torch.Size([batch=B, seq=S, dim=D]) if there's an attribute say _dim_names in the Tensor?
body:
I came to open an issue and found this =)
Even without modifying the API to add `dims=()` as in the request of the Op, maybe it's possible to monkey patch torch in runtime so that  `torch.Size().__repr__()` prints `torch.Size([batch=B, seq=S, dim=D])` if there's an attribute say `_dim_names` in the Tensor?
